title: Worked Solution
text:
To solve for 𝑢, we will first simplify the left side of the equation:
(1/3)(6𝑢+3)=2𝑢+1

Now we have the equation: 2𝑢+1=7-𝑢

To solve for 𝑢, we need to get all the 𝑢 terms on one side and all the constant terms on the other side:
2𝑢+𝑢=7-1
$$3𝑢=6$$
$$𝑢=2$$

Therefore, the solution is $$𝑢=2$$.
